ldc_extent.charseq: On Feb. 28, 1987, Eric and Doris Ferguson were found shot to death in their home off Foster Mill Circle.

Despite identifying a suspect at the time, there was never enough evidence to prosecute, said Spartanburg County Sheriff's Office senior investigator Brandon Letterman, who will be featured on the show.

Despite identifying a suspect at the time, there was never enough evidence to prosecute, said Spartanburg County Sheriff's Office senior investigator Brandon Letterman, who will be featured on the show.
A family member was a person of interest in the killings of the couple, according to the Sheriff's Office.
He said any new findings based on the casework with “Cold Justice” will be brought to the 7th Circuit Solicitor's Office.
The Sheriff's Office first applied to the “Cold Justice” show more than a year ago, Letterman said.

The show's cast features Kelly Siegler, a retired Texas prosecutor; Yolanda McClary, a retired Las Vegas police forensics investigator; and Alan Brown, a retired homicide detective from the Houston Police Department.

The show's cast features Kelly Siegler, a retired Texas prosecutor; Yolanda McClary, a retired Las Vegas police forensics investigator; and Alan Brown, a retired homicide detective from the Houston Police Department.
Most of their family members are from Florida and Ohio, so the team of investigators had to travel to conduct interviews and rebuild a case.
Most of their family members are from Florida and Ohio, so the team of investigators had to travel to conduct interviews and rebuild a case.
Spartanburg Sheriff Chuck Wright said the “Cold Justice” program is a great way to get exposure for an unsolved case that needs more attention.
Investigators work for the families of victims, so any added resources are a benefit, he said.
Sheriff's Office senior investigator William Gary also will be featured on Friday's episode.
The TV crew filmed the “Off the Beaten Path” episode in May, Sheriff's Office spokesman Lt. Kevin Bobo said.

extent.charseq: On Feb. 28, 1987, Eric and Doris Ferguson were found shot to death in their home off Foster Mill Circle.
On Feb. 28, 1987, Eric and Doris Ferguson were found shot to death in their home off Foster Mill Circle.

Despite identifying a suspect at the time, there was never enough evidence to prosecute, said Spartanburg County Sheriff's Office senior investigator Brandon Letterman, who will be featured on the show.
He said any new findings based on the casework with “Cold Justice” will be brought to the 7th Circuit Solicitor's Office.

The show's cast features Kelly Siegler, a retired Texas prosecutor; Yolanda McClary, a retired Las Vegas police forensics investigator; and Alan Brown, a retired homicide detective from the Houston Police Department.

The show's cast features Kelly Siegler, a retired Texas prosecutor; Yolanda McClary, a retired Las Vegas police forensics investigator; and Alan Brown, a retired homicide detective from the Houston Police Department.
The Fergusons moved from Florida to Pauline, where they wanted to live out the rest of their lives together, Letterman said.
They were both found shot in the face.
Most of their family members are from Florida and Ohio, so the team of investigators had to travel to conduct interviews and rebuild a case.
“You've got two dead folks and no one knows who did it,” Wright said.
